keyMoments.title: Battles Humandrills on Kuraigana Island
keyMoments.description: Zoro fights against a group of intelligent Humandrills while still recovering from his wounds. He struggles against their numbers until Mihawk appears and scares them away.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's weakened state after the events at Sabaody and Thriller Bark, setting up his need for training.

keyMoments.title: Learns About Ace's Death from Mihawk
keyMoments.description: Mihawk explains to Zoro about Luffy's brother Ace and his death at Marineford, giving context to the war and Luffy's tragic loss.
keyMoments.significance: Zoro learns about the devastating news that affects his captain, which impacts his motivation and determination.

relationships.description: Mihawk appears to save Zoro from the Humandrills and provides information about world events, foreshadowing their eventual mentor-student relationship.

evolutionMoments.description: Mihawk saves Zoro from the Humandrills and explains the news about Ace's death.

keyMoments.title: Receives News of Ace's Death at Weatheria
keyMoments.description: While working hard labor at Weatheria, Nami receives a newspaper and learns about Ace's death at Marineford.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Nami's emotional reaction and concern for Luffy despite being separated from the crew.

keyMoments.title: Shown Overweight on Boin Archipelago
keyMoments.description: Usopp has become severely overweight from eating too much of the Boin Archipelago's abundant food, showing his lack of discipline.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's current state and sets up his need for training and self-control during the timeskip.

keyMoments.title: Receives News of Ace's Death
keyMoments.description: After knocking down a News Coo, Usopp reads about the tragic events at Marineford.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Usopp's concern for Luffy despite his own challenges.

keyMoments.title: Shown as an Okama at Kamabakka Kingdom
keyMoments.description: Sanji has been transformed into an okama (crossdresser) due to his time at Kamabakka Kingdom, wearing women's clothing and makeup.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the humorous and challenging situation Sanji faces, which becomes motivation for his training.

keyMoments.title: Returns to Normal After Receiving Shocking News
keyMoments.description: The shock of learning about Ace's death appears to snap Sanji back to his normal appearance, though he's still devastated by the news.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the gravity of the news and provides both comic relief and emotional weight.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Makes Peace with Tribe and Birds
keyMoments.description: On Birdie Kingdom, Chopper helps the human tribe befriend the giant birds after initially being captured.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Chopper's ability to communicate and mediate between different species.

keyMoments.title: First Straw Hat Shown Receiving News
keyMoments.description: Chopper is the first crew member shown in the episode receiving news about Ace's death, establishing the emotional core of the episode.
keyMoments.significance: Sets the tone for the episode's theme of scattered crew members learning devastating news.

keyMoments.title: Meets Revolutionary Army at Tequila Wolf
keyMoments.description: Robin speaks with Revolutionary Army members who ask her to join them and inform her about events at Marineford. This is the only canon scene in the episode.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the Revolutionary Army's interest in Robin as the 'Light of the Revolution' and sets up future storylines.

keyMoments.title: Chooses Crew Over Revolutionary Army
keyMoments.description: Robin politely declines the Revolutionary Army's invitation, stating she must reunite with her crew.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Robin's complete loyalty to the Straw Hat Pirates and shows where her true allegiance lies.

relationships.description: The Revolutionary Army has been searching for Robin for ten years due to her Ohara heritage. They call her the 'Light of the Revolution' but respect her decision to return to the Straw Hats.

evolutionMoments.description: Revolutionary Army invites Robin to join them but she chooses her crew instead.

reveals.information: Revolutionary Army has been searching for Robin for ten years, calling her the 'Light of the Revolution' due to her Ohara heritage

keyMoments.title: Discovers Cola on Karakuri Island
keyMoments.description: Franky finds cola and defeats an animal in Dr. Vegapunk's laboratory, with a machine printing out news about Marineford.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Franky exploring Vegapunk's technology, which will lead to his upgrades during the timeskip.

keyMoments.title: Receives News of Ace's Death
keyMoments.description: Franky learns about the tragic events at Marineford through a printed paper from Vegapunk's lab.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Franky's concern for Luffy despite being separated.

keyMoments.title: Composing Music in Harahettania
keyMoments.description: Brook is shown composing music and attempting poses, maintaining his cheerful skeleton persona even while separated.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Brook continuing his musical pursuits and providing comic relief.

keyMoments.title: Receives News of Ace's Death
keyMoments.description: Even the ever-cheerful Brook is affected by learning about Ace's death.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the universal impact of Ace's death on all the Straw Hats.

name.japanese: ジュラキュール・ミホーク

keyMoments.title: Saves Zoro from Humandrills
keyMoments.description: Mihawk appears at Kuraigana Island and his intimidating presence causes the Humandrills to flee in terror.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Mihawk's commanding presence and sets up the dynamic between him and Zoro.

keyMoments.title: Explains Marineford Events to Zoro
keyMoments.description: Mihawk provides context about Luffy's presence at Marineford and Ace's death, showing his awareness of world events.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Mihawk's knowledge and his willingness to inform Zoro about important matters.

relationships.description: Mihawk saves Zoro from the Humandrills and provides information about world events, beginning to establish a connection that will lead to their mentor-student relationship.

evolutionMoments.description: Mihawk saves Zoro and explains the news about Ace's death.

keyMoments.title: Accompanies Zoro Against Humandrills
keyMoments.description: Perona is shown with Zoro on Kuraigana Island as he battles the Humandrills.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Perona's presence on the island with Zoro during his training period.
